original_body_lines: Emeritus Professor N. A. de S. Amaratunga FDSRCS, PhD, DSc, is being awarded the honourary degree of Doctor of Literature at the forthcoming Convocation of the University of Peradeniya. He had previously received the degree of Doctor of Science from the same university. This, indeed, is a rare achievement as he has been awarded the highest degrees in the university system in both science and arts streams.

Prof. Amaratunga had received his education at Ananda College, Colombo. He had entered the University of Peradeniya and obtained a basic degree in dental surgery and later a post graduate degree, FDSRCS, in the UK.
Initially he had served in the Ministry of Health as consultant dental surgeon and later joined the staff of the Dental School, University of Peradeniya.

Prof. Amaratunga excelled in the field of Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery and pioneered the surgical management of the common facial deformity, cleft lip and palate, in Sri Lanka. He also served the Faculty of Dental Science as its Dean. With the research work in facial trauma he could obtain a PhD. He was awarded a DSc in recognition of his work related to cleft lip and palate.

Prof. Amaratunga demonstrated his talents in the field of literature, too, by publishing three major novels and two short story collections. He has subsequently delved into Buddhist philosophy and published five books on the subject (published by Motilal Banarsidass, Delhi, a leading publisher of Buddhist literature), which could be considered a significant contribution to Buddhist literature. He is a regular writer to the newspapers as well, on a variety of subjects; politics, literature, religion, society, etc. In recognition of this work in humanities, he is being awarded the honourary degree of DLitt.
